qas.question: What did Athanasius do to avoid speaking to Alexander on his deathbed?
Who did the Alexandrian people want to be their Bishop?
Did the Bishops have someone else in mind?
Who did Alexander ask for when he was dieing?
What did Athanasius do to avoid speaking to Alexander at lunch?
Who did the Alexandrian people want to be their pope?
Who did the bishops want to be their bishop?
Who did Alexander deny talking to when he was dying?

context: Frances A. M. Forbes writes that when the Patriarch Alexander was on his death-bed he <a3_0>called Athanasius<a3_0/>, who <a0_0><b4_0>fled<b4_0/><a0_0/> fearing he would be constrained to be made Bishop. "When the Bishops of the Church assembled to elect their new Patriarch, the whole Catholic population surrounded the church, holding up their hands to Heaven and crying; "<a1_0>Give us <b5_0>Athanasius<b5_0/><a1_0/>!" The <a2_0>Bishops had nothing better<a2_0/>. <b6_0><b7_0>Athanasius<b7_0/><b6_0/> was thus elected, as Gregory tells us..." (Pope Gregory I, would have full access to the Vatican Archives).
